result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario Olan-De La Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs + DNA surcharges. If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Seek and maintin full time employment.

Comply with any recommendations for Counseling by his agent.
Continue compliance with the Juvenile Court Order he is currently under.

records.addlTxt:
2:08 p.m. Defendant Mario Olan-De La Cruz in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Request for 24 mo Probation w/conditions.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 3: No Contest
Count 4: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 3 & 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Dismiss and read in counts 1, 2, 5, & 6.

ADA Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace concurs with joint agreement. 

BY THE COURT:***
Count 3: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation
Conditions:
Seek and maintin full time employment.
Comply with any recommendations for Counseling by his agent.
Continue compliance with the Juvenile Court Order he is currently under.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.

Count 4: W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation, concurrent
Same Conditions as count 3.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
